intro: Cynoglossum scardicum, commonly known as narrowleaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Cynoglossum scardicum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
